RunOnServerLaunchConfigurationTab was not covering the case where the server or other properties were null, not specified yet, or missing in the existing workspace. Will release fix shortly.

You won't get much further though, since we don't (and can't) provide any support for creating this particular launch configuration from scratch - it has to be created by using Run on Server on a particular resource, which creates the launch config for later reuse. Do you know of any way to block/deter creating an empty launch config without hiding the other instances of it?

I received the same error when trying to create a new config from the launch config dialog.  

From the project's properties page, your launch config type should not show up if your launch shortcut is not mapped to your launch config type.  This mapping is done by specifying the "configurationType" element in your launch shortcut extension.  (I cannot remember if I have requested to have this mapping done for "debug on server".)

From the launch configuration dialog, I do not know a way to deter the user from creating a launch config from scratch, other than making your launch config type a hidden type.  I remember that "debug on server" launch config type was "hidden" before.  (Please correct me if I am wrong.)  Is there any reason why it is no longer hidden?

What are the reasons why you cannot support allowing the user to create this launch config from scratch?

We didn't have this launch config before, and the main reason we created one was so that the user could see it in the launch history and hit F11 (?) to relaunch it again.

The reason a user can't create one manually is that the key ingredient is the selection at the time Run on Server is launched. From any selection we can find what the object is and which server it should be run on, but there is no way to provide a drop down in the launch config tab for all possible selections (i.e. we can't go backward to find all objects that could be run on the server or what selections they correspond to).

I can fix this exception and improve the usability by (e.g.) some text in the launch config tab, but I'm not aware of any existing debug solutions to this problem.

So, the debug solution that we need is to allow for a non-hidden launch config type, but do not allow the user to create a launch config from scratch?  i.e. we need a way to disable the creation of a launch config from scratch?

Yeah, I think that's what we need. I'm trying to think of another way to put it (maybe launch configs that only show in the history? non-persistent?), but that's basically the issue. I can't think of any cases where it would be possible or provide any useful function for the user to create one from scratch.

Fix for IllegalArgumentException released... I think we should probably close this bug and track the creation issue in a new one.

Agreed to close this one and open a new one for the creation issue.

Another thought about creating a launch config from scratch... is it possible to provide a browse button in the launch config tab that allows the user to browse for the project/file from the workspace to launch.  From this selection, you can infer what object to launch?

That's an interesting idea, but there are a couple of issues we'd have to resolve:
 * There are several selection inputs (editor inputs, JEE Navigator) that are not files, so we'd still be missing out on these.
 * Not all files are valid selections - not sure if we'd provide a filtered tree (which could have performance issues), or let them select one and then tell them it is invalid.
After an offline discussion and help from Samantha, we've found it's possible to just hide the launch config and avoid these issues. Change released to 3.0 M4 builds.
